III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/25/25, a youth punched a staff member and the staff
member punched the youth back. They then further engaged in a
physical altercation. It took a significant amount of staff members
to remove the staff member from the wing to stop her from further
engaging with the youth.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed on 5/28/25.There was no
additional information to add regarding allegations other than Staff
1 was terminated due to the altercation.
Youth A was interviewed on 5/29/25 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker.
Youth A reported asking Staff 1 for the television remote so she
could listen to music, but Staff 1 told her no. Youth A reported
Staff 1 told Youth A to go back into her room. Youth A reported
she got upset with Staff 1 and admitted to saying to Staff 1 she
would hit Staff 1. In that moment, Youth A reported Staff 1
responded back by telling Youth A, she (Youth A) would not hit
Staff 1. Youth A reported getting up and going over to the back
corner where Staff 1 was. Youth A intended on hitting Staff 1.
Youth A reported Staff 3 and Staff 2 tried to intervene by getting in
front of Youth A to block her from coming out of her room but were
unsuccessful. Youth A reported hitting Staff 1 in her face with a
closed fist. Youth A reported both she and Staff 1 threw punches
back and forth at one another. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were breaking it
up by grabbing Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 2 and Staff 3
grabbed Staff 1 to get her off the wing but she kept struggling to
get back at Youth A. Youth A reported Staff 1 kept yelling as staff
were removing her from the wing. Youth A reported Staff 1 said,
"I'm going to kill that bitch" as staff struggled to get her off the
wing. Youth A responded back saying that she was not going to
do anything. Youth A reported being offered medical attention.
Youth A reported a body chart was offered but Youth A refused
because she did not have any marks or bruises on her. Youth A
reported that she does not remember if staff made contact with
her body.
2

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on 5/29/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 reported the incident took place during hygiene and chore
time. However, Staff 2 reported Youth A came out of the room
with a bag of snacks during a time when she was not supposed to
be out of the room. Staff 2 reported during hygiene, chore time,
residents are not allowed to come out of the assigned rooms until
the tasks are complete. Staff 2 also reported medication was
being passed. Staff 2 reported Youth A asked to use the remote to
listen to music, but Staff 1 reminded Youth A of the chores that
needed to be completed and that it was 8 am in the morning. Staff
2 also reported the unit was on television restrictions since the day
prior. Staff 2 reported pleading with Youth A to listen and stated to
Youth A how she did not want to argue or fight. Staff 2 reported
hearing Youth A take a pause and say, "oh bitch it ain't gone be
an argument, I'm about to get up and beat your ass”. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 was in the corner when Youth A was observed
walking towards Staff 1. Staff 2 reported warning Staff 1 to get off
the wing, because of Youth A’s history of assault toward staff.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 brushed off the warning. It was reported
Staff 3 tried to block Youth A from leaving her room or getting
closer to Staff 1 but Youth A spun around Staff 3. Staff 2 reported
observing Youth A reach and punch Staff 1. Staff 2 was unsure if
Staff 1 punched back but believed Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s shirt.
Staff 2 reported calling for Staff 4 to provide additional assistance.
Mr. Brooker was interviewed face to face on 5/29/25 at Vista
Maria Beata Hall in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Staff 4 reported working on a different wing when the incident
initially occurred between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 4 reported
reviewing the videos from different wings when he came across
the incident on camera with Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 4 reported
immediately running over to Wing C. Staff 4 reported seeing Staff
5 come from Wing B to assist with pulling Staff 1 off the wing. Staff
4 reported witnessing both Staff 1 and Staff 5 fall to the ground.
Staff 4 reported seeing Staff 1 with a busted lip. Youth A was
offered a body chart but refused. Staff 4 reported not observing
marks or bruises on Youth A. Youth A told him that youth never
really liked Staff 1 and stated that Youth A didn’t like the way Staff
1 told her no. Staff 4 reported during debriefing, Youth A reported
" I don’t give a fuck anymore, I'm going to start beating peoples
asses.” Staff 4 reported No concerns with how Staff 1 interacted
with Youth A. During the debriefing with Staff 1, she was upset
and reported that she blacked out.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face in the community on
6/4/25, with the DCWL consultant participating by phone.
Staff 1 reported Youth A asked to use the television to listen to
music. However, youth were not permitted to use the television
until hygiene and chores were completed, and Youth A was also
on Wing A with television restrictions. Staff 1 reported Youth A
had previously made threats toward them, which resulted in Staff
1 being temporarily removed from the wing. However, due to
staffing needs and the requirement to maintain appropriate staff-
to-youth ratios, Staff 1 eventually returned to the unit. On the day
in question, Staff 1 redirected Youth A to focus on hygiene and
completing assigned chores. During this interaction, Youth A said,
“If you don’t give me the remote, I’ll whoop your ass.” In response,
Staff 1 remained calm and attempted to de-escalate the situation
by stating, “No, we are not going to do this today,” and proceeded
to remind Youth A of the unit rules and expectations. Staff 1
reported continuing to redirect by reminding Youth A of the rules.
Staff 1 reported Youth A stood up and started walking towards
Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 tried to intervene by
trying to block Youth A from coming out of her room, but Youth A
was able to move around Staff 2. It was reported Staff 2 and Staff
3 tried getting between Staff 1 and Youth A but Youth A was still
able to hit Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 put her hands up to
block Youth A, but Youth A was still able to move around Staff 2.
Staff 1 reported Youth A got closer, so Staff 1 backed up. Staff 1
reported Youth A punched her in the face. Staff 1 reported Youth
A punched her three times with a closed fist. Staff 1 reported she
tried to block the punches with her hands which were never
closed. Staff 1 reported Youth A called her a Bitch. Staff 1
reported being upset but denied calling the youth a name. Staff 1
reported she went back not to hit the youth but to keep her from
getting her keys. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 came out to assist. Staff
1 reported another unknown staff member was sitting next to her
but this staff could not intervene due to being pregnant. Staff 1
denied saying anything to the youth as she was walking towards
her. Staff 1 did not get medical care, because she did not feel it
was necessary but had a busted lip.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone with MDHHS worker on
6/19/2025.
Staff 5 reported being employed with Vista Maria for 3 years. Staff
5 reported being assigned to Wing B the day of the incident. Staff
5 reported hearing tussling against the wall, followed by a "clear
area" coming from Wing C. Staff 5 reported being able to enter
4

Wing C and asked Staff 3 to get Staff 4 to assist. Staff 5 reported
seeing Staff 2 in the corner with Youth A. Staff 5 reported seeing
Staff 2 with Staff 1, but Staff 1 was still tugging away from Staff 2.
Staff 5 reported she kept making efforts to de-escalate Staff 1 by
reminding her that she would lose her job if she did not calm
down. Staff 5 reported seeing Staff 1 go towards the direction of
Youth A. Staff 5 reported she had to slam Staff 1 on the ground.
Staff 4 was able to get Staff 1 off Wing C. Staff 5 reported seeing
injuries on her knee. Staff 5 reported sustaining a fractured knee
due to the restraint of Staff 1. Staff 5 reported it took at least 10
minutes to get Staff 1 off the floor.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on
5/29/25.
Therapist reported she was not present when the incident
occurred. Youth A did not disclose to her that there were any other
previous issues with Staff 1. Therapist reported having no
concerns with Staff 1.
Video Footage dated 5/25/25 was reviewed on 5/29/25. Youth A
is observed sitting in the entryway of her room. Staff 1 is observed
in the far corner of the shared common room. Staff 2 is observed
standing near Youth A’s room and Staff 3 is observed sitting next
to Staff 1. At 10:21 a.m., Youth A was observed getting up after
saying something. Staff 2 was seen attempting to intervene and
block Youth A from approaching Staff 1, who was still in the
corner. Staff 2 used her arms and body to block Youth A from
walking toward Staff 1. Staff 1 was observed on video speaking to
Youth A, but it is unknown what is said. As the situation escalated,
Staff 3 stood up because Youth A was actively trying to reach
Staff 1, who remained seated in a chair in the corner. Staff 2
continued to block Youth A with her body as Youth A moved
toward the area where Staff 1 was sitting. Youth A eventually
found a path to Staff 1. Staff 1 stood up and put down the paper
she was holding. Staff 2 attempted to grab Youth A, but Youth A
reached Staff 1, who was now standing. Youth A then punched
Staff 1 in the face. Staff 3 and Staff 2 attempted to intervene. Staff
1 was observed attempting to strike Youth A in return. It was
unclear whether contact was made. After other staff members
moved Staff 1 away from the scene, Staff 1 continued to move
toward Youth A, who was also approaching Staff 1. Staff 2 was
seen grabbing Staff 1 and pulling her away from Youth A. Youth A
was secured in the corner by Staff 3, while Staff 1 was still seen
trying to hit Youth A until further intervention occurred. Staff 1
continued to approach the area where Youth A was standing. She
then went toward the chair and retrieved what appeared to be her
5

badge or keys. Staff 1 continued trying to move back toward
Youth A and had to be physically pulled back by other staff
members. Staff 5 assisted Staff 2 in attempting to escort Staff 1
out of the area. Staff 5 appeared to struggle, as Staff 1 continued
trying to re-enter the wing where Youth A was located.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 5/25/25 and authored by Staff 1.
The incident report is consistent with all interviews.
• Medical Report dated 5/25/25. Documents Youth A visit to
the nurse. It was documented that Youth A had a
superficial scratch on her neck. However, Youth A denied
the scratch being from the incident with Staff 1. Youth A
reported she had been scratching the back of her neck due
to the area being irritated.
• Policy 005-010 – Behavior Management: This policy
states physical intervention shall not be used as a form of
coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation by staff.
• Policy POL-022-114 – Employee Behavior:
This policy prohibits staff behavior such as fighting,
assaulting, threatening, or intimidating clients.
• Policy POL-022-406 – Staff and Client Interaction:
Staff are expected to maintain professional and appropriate
conduct in all interactions with clients. Employees must
foster mutual trust and establish positive working
relationships. The policy explicitly states that corporal
punishment including spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, or pulling hair is strictly prohibited
under any circumstances.
Analysis The agency has been found to be in non-compliance based on
video footage and staff reports. Upon video review, it was
determined that Staff 1 failed to initiate immediate de-escalation
and did not utilize approved de-escalation techniques in
accordance with agency policy. Furthermore, Staff 5 reported
witnessing Staff 1 actively struggle for approximately 10 minutes
to get off the floor, appearing to attempt to re-engage with Youth
A, despite repeated efforts by other staff members to intervene
and prevent further escalation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR:2024SIC0001230 dated 5/15/2024. CAP approved 10/10/24.
SIR:2025SIC0000141 dated 3/19/25. CAP approved 4/10/25.
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
